channel.title: Girl advice (lol)
channel.description:
Well, there's this girl I've known since the 9th grade. (I'm currently in 10th) We talk pretty much every day, but there's this feeling that won't quit bothering me (no, it's not sexual urges, Jesus) I really like her, I just don't know how to tell her. I think she's perfect, I love her personality, looks, everything. When I hug her, I just get this feeling of "I wanna be with you". But there's a catch, she has a boyfriend. I think that if I told her, it would make everything awkward and we would lose the friendship we have right now. If that did happen, I don't know what i'd do.... she makes my day.
Yes, i'm [b]desperate[/b], so I am asking this on MoparScape. I would like everyone to be serious, and not talk about fucking and shit like that, lul.
Any advice?
inb4directedtotreesguide

item.title: Girl advice (lol)
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

Next time you guys are talking/joking around, just smile at her and ask if she has a twin sister with the same personalities. This gets her thinking without making everything completely awkward.

Or, you can just go up to the boyfriend and tell him she is pregnant. Mission accomplished.

Read full topic

item.title: Girl advice (lol)
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Broken Britain:

I can count people I know who have been raped on 2 hands and none of them find it funny. No one I see in the news being raped find it funny. No matured human being should really find it funny at all if you know what rape is even about? I question it because it seems to be such a walk-in-the-park subject for you all.

If you don’t find it funny than why not leave us to what we find funny in our sick, dark, cold little minds and you can go and enjoy your own jokes.

Read full topic

item.title: Girl advice (lol)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Broken Britain:

No matured human being should really find it funny at all if you know what rape is even about?

humour is subjective, just because you do not like rape jokes, or you do not find rape jokes funny doesn’t mean other people should also dislike rape jokes or that other people shouldn’t find rape jokes funny

I’m going to go ahead and assume you don’t like rape jokes because you find them offensive, being offended by something is also subjective and people can be offended at damn near anything, if you police rape jokes because you find them offensive you may as well police every joke because someone will find it offensive

Read full topic

so, rape jokes can’t be funny if you’re a victim of rape?

what about the victims of rape who do find rape jokes funny?

and we’re the narrow minded ones

item.title: Girl advice (lol)
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Haha your correct, in reality it is every man for themselves. I am stupid in this situation because I care about other peoples feelings when I shouldn’t because people don’t consider my feelings a lot of the time in that retrospect.
Its just the way I was brought up.
But in our current society I’d probably say its a mix of kindness and greediness to get the girl.

item.title: Girl advice (lol)
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Kidpaparoach:

But don’t ask her out, that’s a dick move you aren’t aloud to decide if her boyfriend isn’t good enough for her.

As opposed to the girl who’s usually to blinded to see what an asshole her boyfriend is?

Fuck it, every man for themselves when it comes to women. It’s not your girlfriend, fuck what he thinks. If the time comes when she’s your girlfriend, make sure you make it so good for her that she doesn’t jump at the next chance she gets to move on from you. Don’t make her wonder if the grass really is greener over the hill.

Read full topic

item.title: Girl advice (lol)
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Their is no advice we can give you that’s good.
All advice is dependant on the girl and yourself.
But don’t ask her out, that’s a dick move you aren’t aloud to decide if her boyfriend isn’t good enough for her.
You can tell her your feelings and it is up to her if she wants to go to you though.
Gl though

item.title: Girl advice (lol)
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:38, topic:462374”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=565533.msg4115100#msg4115100 date=1348964065]

Dont ever talk about ur rsps life lol

Lol? If she doesn’t like his hobbies then what’s the point…
[/quote]
Atleast someone here seems switched on.

You’d be surprised how lit that you play online games. Now, that’s not too say it’s not a turn off - it is. But, I think everyone can agree with me here; confidence is the key to getting anywhere with anything, especially women. The difficult part is finding the line between cockyness and confidence.

Now, if you show you’re embarrassed about playing Runescape or RSPS, you won’t project confidence. If you openly admit too it, appear as if you don’t give a fuck about RSPS, you project confidence. However, if you claim you’re better than someone, you’ll project cockyness and she will think you’re a bigheaded waste of time. This also stems from the fact, if you enjoy RSPS; you enjoy RSPS. That’s all there is too it, who gives a fuck what she/other people think about your hobbies?[/quote]

My point exactly. I mean, I don’t sit on my laptop or stuff while my girlfriend is here or anything but she knows I make websites in my spare time. I don’t tend to play RSPS anymore but she wouldn’t mind if I did. The only time she’s ever seen me on my laptop is if she falls asleep and I get bored so I come on this/the irc.

Read full topic

item.title: Girl advice (lol)
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:36, topic:462374”][quote author=thakillah link=topic=565533.msg4114995#msg4114995 date=1348953202]
Dont ever talk about ur rsps life lol
[/quote]
Lol? If she doesn’t like his hobbies then what’s the point…[/quote]
Atleast someone here seems switched on.

You’d be surprised how little women care that you play online games. Now, that’s not too say it’s not a turn off - it is. But, I think everyone can agree with me here; confidence is the key to getting anywhere with anything, especially women. The difficult part is finding the line between cockyness and confidence.

Now, if you show you’re embarrassed about playing Runescape or RSPS, you won’t project confidence. If you openly admit too it, appear as if you don’t give a fuck about what people think about you playing RSPS, you project confidence. However, if you claim you’re better than someone, you’ll project cockyness and she will think you’re a bigheaded waste of time. This also stems from the fact, if you enjoy RSPS; you enjoy RSPS. That’s all there is too it, who gives a fuck what she/other people think about your hobbies?

reyx7:

Don’t tell her. Don’t tell her don’t tell her don’t tell her. Wait it out, then sneak in when she’s all emotional and vulnerable.

I’d advise this if you just want to smash and dash. OP clearly would like a relationship, so don’t do this.

Read full topic
